ratings.comment: Terrible lecturer and not helpful at all...ending up dropping this class and the international studies major because she was so bad!

After taking Hertel for Econ 101 I was left to ponder the following question: If it only took 4 seconds to euthanize Eight Belles after the Kentucky Derby, why is "Professor" Hertel still a teacher? Don't Take!
After taking Hertel for Econ 101 I was left to ponder the following question: If it only took 4 seconds to euthanize Eight Belles after the Kentucky Derby, why is "Professor" Hertel still a teacher?

Get a different econ professor, if at all possible. With Hertel you may as well be teaching yourself. After a few weeks of lecture I either took a nap during class or skipped it altogether. Granted, her class is easy, I slacked off majorly and still got an A.

Quite possibly the most absolutely brutal class in all of human history.  Hertel does a HORRIBLE job of teaching information.  The tests questions are SO different than what you learn.  If you're looking for a class to sleep through so you can read the textbook and teach yourself everything you need to know, then take Hertel...absolutely brutal pro

In all honesty, I think she knows what she's talking about. The problem is that nobody else does. I understood her just fine, and I understood my TA's just fine. What made the class hard was that the material presented in class was not representative of the material covered on the test. I attended every lecture and discussion and pulled off an AB.

She made my first econ experience absolutely TERRIBLE. She's horrible in lecture and you can barely understand her. There's really no point in going to lecture because the notes are online. The tests are difficult, but the curve is amazing. That's the only good aspect of this class. If you can get a different prof, then do it because she is terribl

Avoid this professor like the plague!She can't explain the concepts well,her notes and test questions are very,VERY vague,and almost no one in the class can speak correct english.Take the class with another professor.The class is bell-curved as well,several times over,and 50% of the overall grade comes from the final.The notes are online, though.

She is by far the worst professor on this campus.  She is so self-absorbed  and has no compassion towards any of her students.  Her lectures are a waste of time and her tests are impossible.  The curve is good, so if you get a 50, you have a chance for an AB.  Having her teach at this university brings the repuation of the university down.
Easy class. Notes are all posted online. I went to class maybe once a week and still got a AB. Go to discussion the TA's are generally helpful. Homework is not bad.

Proffesor Hertel tries really hard, but rarely succeeds.  She reads right off of the slides she makes, and doesn't go through any problems that are on the tests.  How are you supposed to know how to do a problem when you've never been taught how to solve it correctly? The TA's are also not too helpful.  Do not take this class unless you need it!
Dont go to lecture or discussion just read the book class sucks but its easy to do well since everyone fails the tests and the curve is a joke

WORST LECTURER EVER! She's boring, terrible at explaining concepts, and very unclear in lecture.  TA's are worthless, most of them can't speak any english and my TA even admitted he couldn't even explain one topic well b/c of the language barrier. WHY ARE YOU A TA THEN!  don't go to lecture, read the text book and hope for a good curve on tests.

Her lectures are quite frankly, not very helpful. It's more of a "learn from the book" type of course. Her tests can be quite difficult, but if you really put some effort into studying, you can overcome them.
She's not awful, just the subject is terrible.

Very smart, however, she doesn't teach very well. Her tests cover ideas that are not addressed in lecture or the homework. You must read the book in order to understand some concepts. Only 3 midterms, and you can drop your lowest grade, but everybody does horrible on all of them. She does curve the class, and attendance is not mandatory.

HORRIBLE professor. There is no point in reading the book if you go to lecture. Her lectures are exactly like the text book. I would advise just reading the book and stay home at all costs. She is unable to explain anything and the TA's do nothing for you. Don't go to discussion, they never take attendance. Avoid this class at all costs

I have no doubt that Hertel knows what she's talking about, but she is a terrible lecturer. Lectures are extremely boring and not always clear. If you have some prior Econ knowledge, you should do fine, the curve will save you. If you have to take the class, I suggest finding a different professor.

I was dreading this class at the beginning of the year...and continue to dread each lecture and discussion. She's nice and intelligent; however, she doesn't sufficiently cover the mathematical aspect of micro economics (which is what I really needed). The book is unclear, and I plan on burning it. All I can say is go to discussion. As hard as some

Prof. Hertel is not as bad as everyone says. She is extremely knowledgeable concerning economics, but her teaching skills are mediocre. She is always on-time and well prepared for class. That being said, her midterms are very challenging and not always "fair," but the curve is very generous. The TA's are horrible and nearly impossible to understand

Professor is hot from far back in the lecture hall... That is as good as it gets.  Terrible professor, terrible TA's  -how do they select these people?!?!   Does not teach anything that will be on the test, you get that from the TA's, and they are incompetent and/or don't speak english.  HORRIBLE CLASS!!  Avoid it as long as you can!  HORRIBLE!
I wish I could rate her lower than 1 in everything.  I hate this class.

She tries hard and is knowledgeable about economics; however, her explanations are lacking. I found it hard to learn (she interrupts herself often) and tests don't correlate with the info in class. Reading helps but only marginally. ***CURVE***: approx. 60% of the class gets a B or above (read the syllabus)- the saving grace of the class.
Can not clearly answer any questions. Depends on powerpoint show for all lectures. Lectures are a waste of time.
she is nice and pretty cool. a lot of people don't like her because she is not the greatest lecturer, but ohwell.  she knows alot about econ though and could help you if you ask.
Awful

She knows her economics and is a nice person, but she needs to teach better. Tests are hard since she throws too many curve balls that you never see coming, but the curve is ridiculously nice. Her slides aren't the best, she has a few contradictions on them that even the TA's found bad. But overall the material isn't hard.

I never imagined that I would have a professor this horrible, but my worst nightmares came true.  She is completely incompetent at explaining economics as a whole, and is an awful professor in all aspects: extremely boring, endless lectures in which you learn absolutely nothing due to her inability to make concepts tangible.  She should be fired.

I don't see how people could do poorly in this class, it is an easy A and the curve is ridiculously easy because it seems as though everyone in the class is incompetent.  But I have to admit she is not a good lecturer.
Not the best professor.  However if you are good at reading the book and learning yourself, taking the class with her isn't bad because her curve is more than generous.
After she gave the gave the product example, kiwi-flavored tophats, that's when i knew to stop going to class.  And that was maybe the 5th lecture.

Massive failure as a teacher. Classes are entirely incomprehensive, test are few and very difficult. Once she awkwardly had to stop teaching because it was so obvious that people were packing up or doing other things. nothing personal but there were petitions to fire her I hear.

i have no idea how jo is a professor. if there is ANY way you can get a different professor, switch, because you will be so utterly confused by her,  you won't know what to do with yourself. all she does is read off of her slides. i'm wondering if she truly knows anything at all about economics.
She should be fired. She is unclear and seems helpful but can't teach at all. Avoid taking her.
shes pretty bad, id avoid her if you can. econ isnt that hard be she was confusing in lecture, which is why everyone left the class w/in 15 min of being there almost every day.
Lectures are pretty dull, all notes are online. She is very clear about what she will be testing on.

Come on, shes not that bad! Her lecture notes are very so detailed that you can afford to skip a lecture or 2.  Dont listen to the complaints about the exam either, JH curves the exams so much that (even tho the exams are a little hard) anything above an 84 is usually an A.  Those who r talkin **** on her were prob those at the bottom of the curve
Awful! Don't take her.
She's not as bad as everyone made her out to be. Tests were kinda hard but they have a nice curve to even that out.

She is awful.  Get a new teacher if AT ALL possible.  Her tests are NOTHING like her lectures or what she teaches.  Her final is near impossible.  Reading the book, doing the homework and going to class will do you NO good because her exams have questions that you have never seen before.  FIND ANOTHER PROF!

Probably the best econ teacher on campus if you only learn in examples with booze or cigarettes.  She may even let you share a cig with her before class begins outside the hall.  Word on the street is she ain't doing Econ 101 anymore, so there's nothing to worry about

I came into class optimistic.  I left the class wanting to kill myself.  Lectures are terrible. Practice exams are nothing like her real exams.  The real things are harder and after leaving an exam you want to drink yourself into a submission.  Avoid at all costs.
i'd rather crap in a paper bag and bury my nose in it than take another class from her.
Just read everyone elses comments and they pretty much explain mine

wow. terrible. get another prof if you can. i tried going to lecture but it is pointless...teach it to yourself and pray that you got it right! everyone fails the midterms and she doesn't curve very well...she is very confusing and has a thick german accent. her homework assignments are very lengthy and hard to understand! i want her to die.

This woman supposedly went to one of the top colleges for Econ in Europe....what happened!?!?  She rarely makes sense, her homeworks are confusing, and the exams need to be curved so that you only need to get about half right to get a good grade.  I definitely would not take a class with her if I could.

I enjoy the subject and have no doubt about her knowledge in the field. However, she is not very clear during the lectures. The homework can be very confusing sometimes. Exams are always hard. The mean score of the first midterm was 63/100, and the medium for the second was 57/100. Besides all these, go to her office hours will help!

I haven't gone to a lecture since January and I'm doing fine... just print off the lecture slides and study those and you'll be fine... other than that she's a horrible lecturer... avoid her at all costs
Did not enjoy at all.  Try to find another prof at all costs
she's the anti-christ

Basically I show up to lecture and read the study guide instead of listen so that I can understand. All notes are on the web, so she just reads them in class. I get little out of lectures, but go just in case she says something relevant. Mostly have to learn it on your own if you want to understand.
my rathings say it all
The only way you'll end up learning is by attending discussions. Previous econ 101 professors averaged 90's on exams, our first exam had the class at a 63%.
I dread going to this class because I know that I'll leave more confused each time.  Lectures are choppy, unclear, and often frustrating.  Find another prof!

Lucky for me I enjoy the subject material and am willing to work on it outside of class because I get absolutely NOTHING from lecture.  She spends the entire power lecture trying to explain some confusing example that is supposed to teach us about economics.  I don't doubt her knowledge, but when it comes to teaching she needs a lot of work.

I believe that she is very knowledgeable in the field of economics, however, with her background in Germany, it is hard for her to convey her message.  Understanding her words are not difficult, but understanding her meaning behind them is another story.
one word. awful.
